intro: Kentrothamnus weddellianus, commonly known as the Weddell's kentrothamnus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. The leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment.
